fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.themes

Interface ITemplateDictionary


  • public interface ITemplateDictionary
    Simplification of the dictionary interface to provide template-friendly access to translations with no formatting parameters.

    This simplification permits dictionary access with the following syntax (where the exact syntax will depend on the template system implementation):

    dictionary.translationKey

    The methods getDictionaryInstance() and getDictionaryLocale() provide access to the actual dictionary instance and the context locale, however this prevent usage of any theoretical "dictionaryInstance" or "dictionaryLocale" key names. More generally, implementations should avoid implementing any other interface and avoid providing any other non-default public methods.

    Thread safety: implementations are required to be safe for concurrent access (and are preferably immutable). This assumes that the actual dictionary instance is also safe.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies
    See Also:
    ILocaleService.toTemplateDictionary(fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.locale.IDictionary, java.util.Locale)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String get(String dictionaryKey)
      Gets the translation corresponding to the specified key.
      IDictionary getDictionaryInstance()
      Gets the actual dictionary instance to which this template dictionary delegates translation responsibilities.
      Locale getDictionaryLocale()
      Gets the contextual locale used when selecting translations.

    • Method Detail

      • getDictionaryInstance

        IDictionary getDictionaryInstance()
        Gets the actual dictionary instance to which this template dictionary delegates translation responsibilities.
        Returns:
        the non-null dictionary instance.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getDictionaryLocale

        Locale getDictionaryLocale()
        Gets the contextual locale used when selecting translations.
        Returns:
        the non-null locale.
        Since:
        1.0

      • get

        String get(String dictionaryKey)
        Gets the translation corresponding to the specified key. This will automatically delegate to an instance of ILocaleService in order to negotiate the best-match translation.

        Note: some template systems may be unable to process keys containing certain symbols (for example, the "." character is generally problematic as it is normally syntactically-significant).

        Parameters:
        dictionaryKey - the key identifying a required text translation in the actual dictionary instance.
        Returns:
        the best-match translation, or the dictionary key if no match can be negotiated.
        Since:
        1.0
